p: SARS-CoV-1 and SARS-CoV-2 belong to the β-genus of coronavirus family [ 5]. The genetic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 has around 80% identity to SARS-Co V-1 [ 6]. In SARS-CoV-1 the defined receptor biding domain of the membrane Spike (S) protein of the virus uses host angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) as the receptor for fusion of viral and host membranes [ 7–9]. It appears that SARS-CoV-2 also uses the same mechanism for host attachment [ 5, 10, 11].
